labels.analysis: The MCP Server acts as a status monitoring tool for major digital platforms, allowing users to check the operational health and status of various services in real-time. Its primary functionality revolves around providing up-to-date information on service availability, which helps users quickly identify and respond to disruptions. The available tool "status" suggests that this server primarily serves as an observer for platform health monitoring.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Services Monitoring" was chosen because the server's core function aligns with tracking the status of web-based platforms. While predefined categories like "Web Search & Research" and "API Integration" are somewhat relevant, they are not as precise as a custom label for monitoring purposes. The secondary labels of "Web Search & Research" and "API Integration" were selected because the server likely aggregates data from various sources (research-like) and may utilize APIs to fetch status information.

tools.name: status
tools.description: Check operational status of major digital platforms

command.description: Command to execute (list, --all, or platform with -- prefix like --github)

server_info_crawled.name: Status Observer
server_info_crawled.author: @imprvhub/mcp-status-observer
server_info_crawled.overview: Monitor and query the operational status of major digital platforms in real-time. Get detailed status information for specific services and components with a simple query interface. Stay informed about platform health to quickly respond to service disruptions.

tools.name: status
tools.description: Check operational status of major digital platforms

command.description: Command to execute (list, --all, or platform with -- prefix like --github)

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@imprvhub/mcp-status-observer/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
